title: Rethinking Mean Opinion Scores in Speech Quality Assessment: Aggregation through Quantized Distribution Fitting
author: Yuto Kondo (NTT Corporation, Japan), Hirokazu Kameoka (NTT Corporation, Japan), Kou Tanaka (NTT Corporation, Japan), Takuhiro Kaneko (NTT Corporation, Japan), ...
relevance_why: The proposed aggregation methods for mean opinion scores (MOS) can enhance prediction models for speech quality assessment that Haohe Liu may find applicable in audio quality evaluation and restoration tasks.
background: Speech quality assessment aims to predict the quality of speech samples without relying on lengthy listener evaluations, typically utilizing ratings on a scale of 1 to 5.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel score aggregation method based on quantized distribution fitting to improve the accuracy of mean opinion score predictions in speech quality assessment.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods, such as the mean opinion score (MOS) and N-lowest MOS, face limitations in handling variability in ratings and incorrect annotations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves on these limitations by modeling annotator behavior as selecting the closest discrete rating from a continuous mental score, optimizing the aggregation through a derived latent distribution.

key_innovation: The method quantizes a latent normal distribution to model how ratings are actually assigned, which allows for a more accurate representative score over traditional MOS.
real_world_impact: This innovative approach could significantly enhance the quality assessment of synthesized speech systems, improving user experience in applications like text-to-speech and voice conversion.
limitations: The method may require further refinement in optimization techniques to ensure robust performance across variable datasets.

new_terms.mean opinion score (MOS): **Mean Opinion Score (MOS)** is a common measure used to assess the quality of audio and video data based on subjective evaluations from listeners.
new_terms.quantized distribution fitting: **Quantized distribution fitting** refers to the process of approximating a continuous distribution by a discrete representation, improving the modeling of complex behaviors like human scoring.
